definition: luxuriant/buxom/variant of 豐|丰[feng1]/variant of 風|风[feng1]/appearance/charm

sentences.english: The gentle acidity and marked fruitiness of a well balanced Pinot Gris perfectly complements roast pork with a stewed pear sauce.
sentences.chinese: 水果香味丰裕浓烈，完美融合了炖梨酱烤猪肉的美味。

sentences.english: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;
sentences.chinese: 我若因财物丰裕，因我手多得资财而欢喜。

sentences.english: I called it the curse of abundance.
sentences.chinese: 我把它成为丰裕的魔咒。

sentences.english: The biggest zapper of having an abundance of time is the experience of always being behind.
sentences.chinese: 可以拥有丰裕时间的最大武器就是总是保持领先。

sentences.english: We bring contentment and affluence to employees.
sentences.chinese: 我们付予员工满足与丰裕。

sentences.english: If you like, the copiousness of autumn will stack the thinking between you and me.
sentences.chinese: 如果你愿意，秋天的丰裕会堆满你我的思绪。

sentences.english: Their travel would take them to safe and bountiful breeding grounds.
sentences.chinese: 它们的旅行会把它们带到安全而丰裕的繁殖地。
幸福是一块丰裕的宝石。

sentences.english: The furniture and DECOR of his room spelled elegance and a substantial income.
sentences.chinese: 他的室内家具和装饰意味高雅和收入丰裕。

sentences.english: Only when he's in motion do the floodgates of abundance open.
sentences.chinese: 只有他在行动时圈住丰裕的闸门才会打开。

definition: having ample food and clothing (idiom); well fed and clothed
